meanings.definition: To promise or agree to do something
meanings.sent1: She was guarantying to finish her homework before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: He is guarantying to help his friend with the project.
meanings.sent3: The cat was guarantying to catch the elusive red dot.
meanings.sent4: The sun guarantying to rise each morning brings comfort.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was guarantying a surprise quiz to keep the students on their toes.

meanings.definition: To provide a guarantee for something
meanings.sent1: The company was guarantying a full refund if the product didn't work.
meanings.sent2: He is guarantying the quality of the car he is selling.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was guarantying the safety of its hidden acorn stash.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse guarantying safe passage through the stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The warranty was guarantying a replacement for any defects.

meanings.definition: To make sure or certain of something
meanings.sent1: Double-checking the address was guarantying they wouldn't get lost.
meanings.sent2: She is guarantying the accuracy of the report before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The lucky charm was guarantying good fortune to its owner.
meanings.sent4: His confident smile guarantying success in the interview.
meanings.sent5: The lock on the door was guarantying security while they were away.
